intro: Coptophyllum, commonly known as the golden bellflower, is a genus of flowering plants belonging to the family Campanulaceae. These plants are characterized by their showy, bell-shaped flowers that typically range in color from yellow to orange. They are native to regions in the Mediterranean and parts of Asia, where they thrive in sunny, well-drained soils. The leaves are usually lance-shaped and arranged alternately along the stem. Coptophyllum species are often cultivated for their ornamental value in gardens and are relatively easy to grow in moderate climates.
